Unknown.translation: Just as a sieve has so many holes and if it slanders an earthen pot, then how can it be respected.

Unknown.translation: Just as an acacia tree which is full of thorns call a lotus flower thorny, this allegation will not be appreciated by anyone.

Unknown.translation: Just as leaving pearls, a filth-eating crow cracks a joke on swan, the eater of pearls of lake Mansarover, this is nothing but his dirtiness.

Unknown.translation: Similarly sin-filled I, am a big sinner. The sin of slandering the whole world pleases me.  (512)
